dublin_core.dcvalue: This paper describes the development of a miniaturized wearable vital sign monitor which is aimed for use by elderly at home The development of a compound sensor for pulse rate motion and skin temperature is reported A pair of infrared sensor working in reflection mode was used to detect the pulse rate from various sites over the body including the wrist and finger Meanwhile a motion sensor was used to detect the motion of the body In addition the temperature on the skin surface was sensed by a semiconductor temperature sensor A prototype has been built into a box with a dimension of 2 x 2 5 x 4 cm3 The device includes the sensors microprocessor circuits battery and a wireless transceiver for communicating data with a data terminal
Studies in health technology and informatics
Vital sign monitoring for elderly at home: development of a compound sensor for pulse rate and motion.
